comment.author: 8149596@N07
comment._content:
That is a picture of Luna Island. Luna Island has a man-made bridge over to it from Goat Island. 
The Ice Bridge forms (as in ettenw's photo) when the ice would build up in the lower river below the Rainbow Bridge. You could walk out onto the ice and during prohibition shanties would be set up on the ice to sell booze. 
They stopped allowing people to walk out onto the ice in 1912 after a early thaw caused the ice to break up. Three people were killed.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: getglassy:  Thank you for the interesting history of the ice bridge and Luna Island.  We will include the information in our description of the photograph when the database is updated.

comment.author: 8149596@N07
comment._content: That is the Honeymoon bridge in the photo. The Honeymoon bridge collapsed in 1938 and was replaced with the Rainbow Bridge.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thanks for the sharp eyes getglassy.  We will add that the Honeymoon bridge is visible in the background of the image.
